intro: Cryptotaenia canadensis, commonly known as Canadian cow-weed, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and roadsides. Its leaves are aromatic and have been used historically in herbal remedies. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators.
